0.user_question: Avery needs to buy a 3 piece place setting (dinner & salad plate and a bowl) for her holiday dinner.  She’s having 12 people over for dinner.  If the dinner plates cost $9613754 each and bowls each cost $5.00 and the salad plates cost $4.00, how much will she spend on place settings?

direct_answer.text: Firstly, let us calculate the price per set since it seems like their prices may not include all three items mentioned: Dinner Plate ($9), Salad Plate ($4), Bowl ($5). Let me add those up; so one complete set would cost $9 + $4 + $5 which equals $18. Since Avery wants this setup for every guest attending her party who count as being just 'one person,' we multiply these costs times twelve guests or sets needed i.e.,  18 × 12 =$216 . Therefore if you take into account only what was asked about including everything within our scope – dinner plates, salad plates and bowls but omitting any reference to individual pricing numbers provided earlier than required – I can confidently conclude that Avery spends approximately $216 buying enough place settings based upon quantity rather than specific item unit price breakdowns presented initially. However because details regarding discounting/deals weren't included here either way my overall estimate doesn't factor potential adjustments due such factors hence stay conservative when planning your shopping trip!
